titleStmt.title: Description of University of Pennsylvania Ms. Codex 838: Erotopaignion

notesStmt.note: Title and attribution from caption heading (f. 1r).
Alternate title represents the spelling used for some published versions of Angeriano's work.
Incipit: Libellus ad lectorem. Doctrinam si forte cupis, si forte lepores/Pierios, Domini ne lege scripta mei...
Explicit: Non hic corpus adest, non hic cinis ater, at una/flamma calens, cremat haec flamma. Viator abi. Telos est to.
Dedicated to Joannes Jacobus de Castillione, archbishop of Bari, (f. 1r).

msIdentifier.repository: Kislak Center for Special Collections, Rare Books and Manuscripts

msContents.summary: Collection of short Latin poems in elegiac couplets, many of which are addressed to "Caelia."
msContents.textLang: Latin, with title and final words in Greek and notes inside the covers in Greek and Italian

supportDesc.extent: 35 leaves : 194 x 146 (148 x 85) mm. bound to 196 x 150 mm
supportDesc.foliation: Paper, 35; [1-35]; modern foliation in pencil, upper right recto.

history.provenance: Sold by Laurence Witten (New Haven, Conn.), 1955.

keywords.term: Love poetry, Latin (Medieval and modern)--Early works to 1800
